reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Combating Exploitative Rural Child Labor in Peru

description.narrative: Advocacy for international labour standards, labour law, fundamental principles and rights at work (child labour, forced labour, non-discrimination in the workplace, freedom of association and collective bargaining); formalisation of informal work, occupational safety and health.

This award supports advocacy for international labor standards, labor law, fundamental principles and rights at work. More specifically, this includes To combat exploitative child labor in the Huancavelica, Pasco, and Junin regions of Peru. The project will contribute to the prevention and eradication of rural child labor, particularly in agriculture and among indigenous populations, by providing child. To combat exploitative child labor in the Huancavelica, Pasco, and Junin regions of Peru. The project will contribute to the prevention and eradication of rural child labor, particularly in agriculture and among indigenous populations, by providing children with better access to quality education, linking beneficiaries to national social protection programs, and by improving the livelihoods of families dependent on agriculture and seasonal work, so families do not need to rely on child labor to meet basic needs..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Bureau of International Labor Affairs/Office of Child Labor, Forced Labor, and Human Trafficking

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S. assistance builds the capacity of Peruvian institutions to combat transnational organized crime more effectively, improve citizen security and social inclusion, sustainably manage Peru's diverse and fragile environment, and expand the benefits of Peru's economic progress to more of its citizens. Peru is one of the world's largest cocaine producers, a major money laundering center, a principal source of illegally logged timber and illegally mined gold, and the largest source of counterfeit U.S. currency worldwide. While economic growth has slowed for the past two years due to a slump in international commodity prices and the failure to implement second generation reforms, successive Peruvian governments have pursued judicious, market-based economic policies yielding over a decade of economic growth averaging five percent, which has halved poverty rates, reduced infant mortality, increased lifespans, and expanded access to education. Peru is one of the United States' most steadfast democratic partners in the region, and the continuation of bi-lateral assistance advances U.S. national security and economic interests.

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Salaries and Expenses, Departmental Management, Labor

description.narrative: Quarterly disbursements by project. May include disbursements for: salary and benefits, travel and per diem, logistical expenses and other costs of delivering technical assistance.
